{"step_by_step_thinking": "Lymphatic spread refers to the process where cancer cells spread from the primary site to distant sites through the lymphatic system. Basal cell carcinoma is a type of skin cancer that grows slowly and is unlikely to spread to lymph nodes or distant sites. Squamous cell carcinoma, malignant melanoma, and Merkel cell carcinoma, on the other hand, are more aggressive and have a higher likelihood of lymphatic spread.", "answer_choice": "A. Basal Cell Carcinoma"}
